title: Alan Skene
text:
Alan Leslie Skene (2 October 1932 – 13 August 2001) was a South African <a href="List%20of%20dual-code%20rugby%20internationals">dual-code international</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>, and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa</a>, and at provincial level for <a href="Western%20Province%20%28rugby%20team%29">Western Province</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Centres">centre</a>, i.e. number 12 or 13, and representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">South Africa</a> and <a href="Rugby%20League%20XIII">Rugby League XIII</a>, and at club level for <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Wakefield%20Trinity%20players">Heritage № 651</a>), and <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a>, as a , or , i.e. number 3 or 4, or 6.
Background.
Alan Skene was born in <a href="Cape%20Town">Cape Town</a>, South Africa, he was a pupil at Muizenberg High School in <a href="Muizenberg">Muizenberg</a>, and he died aged 68 in <a href="George%2C%20Western%20Cape">George, Western Cape</a>, South Africa.
Playing career.
International honours.
Alan Skene won a cap for <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa</a> (RU) while at Western Province playing <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%2313.%20Outside%20centre%20.26%2012.%20Inside%20centre">inside centre</a> against France at <a href="Ellis%20Park%20Stadium">Ellis Park Stadium</a>, <a href="Johannesburg">Johannesburg</a> on 16 August 1958, represented <a href="Rugby%20League%20XIII">Rugby League XIII</a> (RL) while at Wakefield Trinity, and won caps for <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">South Africa</a> (RL) while at Wakefield Trinity in 1963 against Australia (2 matches).
Championship Final appearances.
Alan Skene played right-, i.e. number 3, in <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>'s 3-27 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1959–60 season</a> at <a href="Odsal%20Stadium">Odsal Stadium</a>, <a href="Bradford">Bradford</a> on Saturday 21 May 1960.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Alan Skene played right-, i.e. number 3, and scored two <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">tries</a> in <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>'s 38-5 victory over <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> in the <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20Challenge%20Cup">1959–60</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1959–60 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 14 May 1960, and played right- in the 12-6 victory over <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a> in the <a href="1961%E2%80%9362%20Challenge%20Cup">1961–62</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1961%E2%80%9362%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1961–62 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 12 May 1962.
County Cup Final appearances.
Alan Skene played right-, i.e. number 3, in <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>'s 16-10 victory over <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a> in the <a href="1960%E2%80%9361%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1960–61</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1960%E2%80%9361%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1960–61 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 29 October 1960, and played right-, and scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> in the 19-9 victory over <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> in the <a href="1961%E2%80%9362%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1961–62</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1961%E2%80%9362%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1961–62 season</a> at <a href="Odsal%20Stadium">Odsal Stadium</a>, <a href="Bradford">Bradford</a> on Saturday 11 November 1961.
Club career.
Alan Skene made his début for <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>, alongside fellow South African <a href="Jan%20Lotriet">Jan Lotriet</a>, in the 19-7 victory over <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford</a> at <a href="The%20Jungle%20%28Wheldon%20Road%29">Wheldon Road</a>, <a href="Castleford">Castleford</a> on Thursday 25 December 1958.
